column4: anyone in here good with samba? I have shared a folder on my ubuntu machine but I cant see it from windows
if I start run -> the ip address of my ubuntu machine I get a login but the username/password for my machine doesnt work.. so i cant get in
you try no user and no pass?
- umm no 1 second let me try that :)
- nope.. it says "enter a username and password"
- this is a windows machine i am on trying to browse a ubuntu share
edit your .conf file to allow guests
- http://pastebin.com/5jgw8eqX <-- that is my conf file
- line 240
- any thoughts now you can see my conf ?
this should help you http://www.debuntu.org/guest-file-sharing-with-samba
- by you referencing my to that link can you see why my smb.conf is not working?
- because I don't really want to have a no user/pass login on this share
- I would prefer to just get it working if possible
did it work
- I didnt try it cos I don't really want to not use a password.. but I will test it now 1 sec
oh, then sudo smbpasswd -a username
- my smb.conf doesnt match to what it is telling me to do
try sudo smbpasswd -a username
- ok 1 sec
- hmm ok it accepted the password but it doesnt show any files
- hmm ok it accepted the password but it doesnt show any files
dumb question is there any files in the folder?
